title: Here‚Äôs How Vybz Kartel, Lila Ik√© & More Reacted to Their 2026 Best Reggae Album Grammy Nominations: ‚ÄòThis Is a New Tidal Wave for¬†Reggae‚Äô
summary: The five finalists for best reggae album were revealed on Friday (Nov. 7).
body: As Jamaica picks up the pieces in the aftermath of Hurricane Melissa’s historic devastation , the global reach of their artists remains cause for celebration. On Friday (Nov. 7), the Recording Academy revealed the five nominees for best reggae album at the 2026 Grammy Awards ‚Äî and Jamaican musicians snagged every single spot. The five newly Grammy-nominated albums are Treasure Self Love (Lila Ik√©), Heart & Soul (Vybz Kartel), Blxxd & Fyah (Keznamdi), From Within (Mortimer) and No Place Like Home (Jesse Royal). Notably, Billboard correctly predicted four out of the five nominees in its round-up of global field Grammy predictions . “It’s exactly 464 days ago to the day I achieved a significant milestone with my freedom, and within this time span, I have been nominated [for a Grammy Award] twice,” Kartel exclusively told Billboard . “I am genuinely thankful that my artistic contributions have once again garnered such esteemed attention from the Recording Academy.” Earning his second nod in this category in as many years, Kartel’s latest Grammy nomination bookends a seismic comeback year that began, in earnest, with his January Billboa‚Ä¶

title: Rod Wave Arrested on Weapon and Drug Charges in¬†Atlanta
summary: The rapper-singer was taken into custody in Fulton County, Georgia, on Nov. 7.
body: Rod Wave has been arrested by the Atlanta Police Department on multiple weapon and drug charges. The 27-year-old rapper-singer, whose real name is Rodarius Green, was taken into custody Friday (Nov. 7) in Fulton County, Georgia, and charged with possession of a firearm or knife during the commission of or attempt to commit certain felonies, reckless driving, possession of a Schedule V controlled substance and possession of Schedule II controlled substance, according to TMZ . Rod Wave was booked into Fulton County Jail following his arrest, Fox 5 Atlanta reported, and as of Saturday morning remained in custody. In a statement sent to Billboard Saturday evening, Rod Wave’s attorney — Drew Findling of Findling Law Firm — said: “On November 7, the same day Rodarius Green earned a Grammy nomination, he was unjustly profiled and unlawfully arrested in Atlanta. The arresting officer belongs to the Atlanta Police Department‚Äôs controversial Crime Suppression Unit‚Äîa group known for its aggressive tactics and emphasis on high arrest numbers rather than genuine public safety. Mr. Green was targeted as part of this quota-driven approach, a practice that undermines justi‚Ä¶

body: Britney Spears is back on Instagram after a short break from the platform. In the image, she poses in a white lace bra, gray and black underwear, and black boots. title: Megan of KATSEYE Shares Real-Time Reactions to Group‚Äôs Grammy Nominations: ‚ÄòThe Group Chat Is Blowing¬†Up‚Äô
summary: "With what we represent globally, it means so much to each and every one of us," the Honolulu native exclusively shares with Billboard.
body: There are few moments more immediately significant than an artist learning they’ve earned a Grammy nomination. For KATSEYE ‘s Megan, that revelation arrived not during the live reveal or from celebratory screams, but in the glow of KATSEYE’s group chat. “I woke up a little bit later so I woke up to the group chat going crazy ‚Äî that’s literally how I found out,” she tells Billboard exclusively during a phone interview just two hours after the Recording Academy announced the 2026 nominees in full. “It’s just me here right now, but the group chat is blowing up.” With nods in best new artist and best pop duo/group performance, Megan says KATSEYE’s two nominations feel like a confirmation of the whirlwind experience the sextet has been on from their 2023 Dream Academy competition series to climbing up the Billboard Hot 100 as “Gabriela” reaches a new peak of No. 37 this week. “It’s all settling in and I feel like I haven’t fully come to my ‚Äî I don’t know ‚Äî I feel like it hasn’t settled in fully that we are nominated for two Grammy Awards,” she adds. “It’s crazy, I lit‚Ä¶

title: How a Spiritual Retreat Inspired Chiquis‚Äô ‚ÄòFlores En Mi Alma‚Äô Album & More Uplifting Moments in¬†Latin¬†Music
summary: Plus, Marc Anthony and Henry C√°rdenas host the 12th annual Maestro Cares Gala.
body: From career milestones to new music releases to major announcements and those little important moments,  Billboard  editors highlight uplifting moments in Latin music. Here‚Äôs what happened in the Latin music world this week. The 2025 Maestro Cares Gala The Maestro Cares Foundation, co‚Äëfounded by Marc Anthony and Henry C√°rdenas, celebrated its 12th Annual ‚ÄúChanging Lives, Building Dreams‚Äù Gala this week at the Cipriani Wall Street in New York City. Key leaders, philanthropists, and entertainment figures ‚Äî including Eva Longoria and J Balvin ‚Äî were present at the ceremony. Longoria was honored with the Maestro Cares Community Hero Award for educating and empowering Latin women through Eva Longoria Foundation (ELF), and Balvin received the Trailblazer of Cultural Empowerment Award for his commitment to raising awareness about mental health. ‚ÄúFor Henry and me, tonight is not just a gala; it‚Äôs a powerful reminder of what we can achieve when talent and generosity come together,” Anthony said in a press statement. “Thanks to their leadership, and to the commitment of every person in this room, we are fostering opportunities and support for girls and boys in need. Wh‚Ä¶

title: Jelly Roll Cancels New Zealand Show Due to Illness: ‚ÄòPlease Forgive¬†Me‚Äô
summary: "I pride myself on showing up no matter what. Just couldn‚Äôt do it this time," Jelly Roll wrote.
body: Jelly Roll has been forced to cancel the final date of his debut Australia and New Zealand tour , citing illness, just hours before the headline show was set to kick off. The Grammy-nominated, multi-platinum artist announced via Instagram on Friday (Nov. 8) that he would not be performing at The Outer Fields at Western Springs in Auckland, New Zealand, as originally scheduled for tonight. ‚ÄúDear Auckland, I‚Äôve done everything I can,‚Äù he wrote on Instagram. ‚ÄúI just can‚Äôt shake it. It breaks my heart, I‚Äôve probably missed three shows in the last decade. I pride myself on showing up no matter what. Just couldn‚Äôt do it this time. Please forgive me.‚Äù Fans reported that they didn‚Äôt discover news of the cancellation until arriving at the venue. The late notice left many frustrated and disappointed, particularly as some had travelled long distances to attend Jelly Roll‚Äôs first-ever New Zealand performance. The cancelled concert was set to wrap Jelly Roll‚Äôs tour across Australia and New Zealand, which marked the country-rock star‚Äôs first-ever visit to the region. The run included back-to-back shows at Melbourne‚Äôs Rod Laver Arena (Oct. 28‚Äì29), a sold-out night at Sydney‚Äôs Qudos Bank Arena (N‚Ä¶

title: Mod Sun on Breakup With Avril Lavigne: ‚ÄòIf I Run Into You, It‚Äôs All¬†Love‚Äô
summary: The former couple met in early 2021 while collaborating on music, and their joint single ‚ÄúFlames‚Äù dropped just weeks later.
body: Mod Sun is reflecting on his high-profile engagement to Avril Lavigne ‚Äî and how the fallout ultimately helped him grow. In a resurfaced episode of Bunnie Xo‚Äôs Dumb Blonde podcast clip recorded in June 2024 and posted Nov. 8, the multi-genre artist opened up about the relationship‚Äôs end with surprising clarity, saying: ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre two different people, but I think I had a great influence on her.‚Äù He added that the ‚ÄúSk8er Boi‚Äù singer helped him ‚Äúgrow up,‚Äù and that he’s now more secure in his identity than ever before. The former couple met in early 2021 while collaborating on music, and their joint single ‚ÄúFlames‚Äù dropped just weeks later. A whirlwind romance followed, with Mod proposing in Paris in April 2022. Less than a year later, the pair called off the engagement in February 2023. Though Lavigne has remained publicly silent on the split, Mod has continued to speak openly. In July 2023, he released the breakup track ‚ÄúStrangers,‚Äù with lyrics detailing the rise and fall of their relationship. The Paris-shot music video ‚Äî filmed in the same city where he proposed ‚Äî added further emotional weight. On the podcast, Mod said that his perspective on the breakup has shifted over time: ‚Ä¶

title: Live Nation, Spotify, SM Entertainment Declines Highlight Rough Week for Music¬†Stocks
summary: Numerous companies that reported solid third-quarter earnings results this week were nonetheless punished by investors.
body: Music stocks had their worst week in three months, as most companies that reported earnings this week were penalized for not offering more to investors. Spotify, Live Nation, SM Entertainment and Reservoir Media all finished the week ended Nov. 7 in the red ‚Äî though live entertainment companies Sphere Entertainment and MSG Entertainment bucked the trend by posting sizable gains after putting out their quarterly earnings reports. The 19-company Billboard Global Music Index (BGMI) fell 5.0% to 2,703.11 as losers outnumbered winners 15 to 4. After soaring earlier in the year, the BGMI is now 13.3% below its all-time high of 3,117.20 (in the week ended June 30) and is now equal to its value in early May. Related Live Nation Hits Q3 Revenue Record as Concert Demand Surges, With No Signs of Slowing Down Billboard's Live Music Summit Honors Khalid with VENU's Disruptor Award Female Agents Have Come a Long Way, But There's Still Progress to Be Made: 'We Have to Continue to Fight for Each Other' iHeartMedia was a notable exception to the carnage.
